About Environmental Scan Framework Tools MAP Clearinghouse Benchmarks

MARCEdit

Tool Creator/Maintainer

Created and maintained by Terry Reese, currently a librarian at Ohio State University.

Abstract

MarcEdit allows for several use cases:

  • Edit and transform metadata files from and to MARC records
  • Converts MARC21 to eye-readable text format
  • Validate MARC records
  • Generate reports (e.g. count of field presence in a record set),
  • Send metadata to an SQLite or MYSQL database and run queries

Documentation

Site URL Source Code URL Documentation URL
http://marcedit.reeset.net/ http://marcedit.reeset.net/downloads http://marcedit.reeset.net/

Analysis

Task Metric Completed successfully?
User can check for the presence of an element, attribute, or value Completeness
User can implement spell-checker technology for metadata values Accuracy
User can check for appropriate grammar and language syntax Accuracy
User can confirm that descriptive metadata accurately describes content Accuracy
User can check when/how metadata was created or changed via versioning tools Provenance
User can check when/how metadata was created or changed; the source of the metadata; the content standard, cataloging rules, or metadata application profile used by querying a specific element Provenance
User can confirm the values adhere to element datype formatting expectations (e.g. date formatting, time formatting, strings, numbers) Accessibility
User can determine what controlled vocabulary was used by querying an element attribute or tag subfield
User can dtermine correct element usage according to established profile definitions
User can check that data is well-formed in order to be correctly parsed by a machine
User can check for inaccurate character encodings
User can cluster, facet, or generate value sets to confirm that values meant to refer to like concepts or agents are consistently applied
User can perform reconciliation services to match element values against published entities
User can check for outdated, offensive, or biased terminology Timeliness
User can confirm that adequate information is available for locating or accessing a target object
